A robber armed with a sawn-off shot gun threatened staff at a bookmakers and stole cash. 
The man, who was covering his face with a balaclava, walked into the branch of Ladbrokes in Chadderton shopping precinct, Oldham, at about 8.15pm on January 21. 
He pulled a double barrelled sawn-off shot gun from a plastic bag, before using it to threaten a staff member and a customer. 
The staff member was forced to open till and safe. Read More 
The robber stole a quantity of money and fled from the bookies. 
He is described as Asian or black, aged 21 to 22-years-old and of heavy build. 
The man was wearing a black jacket and black balaclava. 
Police have launched an investigation and are appealing for any witnesses to come forward. Read More Mum beaten up and robbed after dropping kids off at school gates 
DC Mike Hayman, of GMP’s Oldham Borough, said: “The man was carrying a distinctive plastic bag, and I would appeal to anyone who saw the man entering the bookmakers before the robbery, or has any information about who may be responsible, to contact police. 
Anyone with information is asked to contact police on 0161 856 9080, 101 quoting incident number 2205 21/01/17, or the independent charity Crimestoppers, on 0800 555 111. Like us on Facebook
